pageContext.claim: “Spoke to Saudi Arabia and others about increasing oil flow. All are in agreement. The California tax on gasoline is causing big problems on pricing for that state. Speak to your Governor about reducing.”
pageContext.analysis: California has long had high gas taxes -- the second highest in the nation -- but that's not what is causing a spike in prices. (High gasoline taxes will reduce consumption and ease pressure on oil prices. If the taxes drop, the opposite will happen.) Trump had just tightened sanctions on Iran, vowing to eliminate their oil exports. So to prevent prices from rising the administration is jawboning Saudi Arabia and other oil exporting countries about boosting production. Trump claims he's reached an agreement but the Saudi have publicly been non-committal. After this tweet, the White House issued a statement making clear that Trump himself did not have these conversations, but that lower-level White House officials did.
